intro: Limonium angustebracteatum, commonly known as narrow bract limonium, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Europe and northern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in dune environments. Its narrow bracts and delicate appearance make it a distinctive member of the Plumbagaceae family. Limonium angustebracteatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
